qas.question: How many people work in the New York publishing industry?
Which New York-based newspaper has won the Pulitzer Prize for journalism?
Along with the New York Times, what national daily newspaper is based in New York?
What was the founding year of the New York Daily News?
Who was the founder of the New York Post?
How many newspaper offices are located in New York?
How many magazines can call NYC home?
How many national newspapers out of the three are from New York?
Which two national newspapers are located in New York?

answers.text: The Wall Street Journal and The New York Times

qas.question: When was the New York Daily News founded?

context: <a5_0>More than <a7_0>2<a7_0/>00<a5_0/> newspapers and <a6_0>350<a6_0/> consumer magazines have an office in the city, and the publishing industry employs about <a0_0>25,000<a0_0/> people. Two of the three national daily newspapers in the United States are New York papers: <a2_0><a8_0>The Wall Street Journal<a2_0/> and <a1_0>The New York Times<a8_0/><a1_0/>, which has won the most Pulitzer Prizes for journalism. Major tabloid newspapers in the city include: The New York Daily News, which was founded in <a3_0><a9_0>1919<a9_0/><a3_0/> by Joseph Medill Patterson and The New York Post, founded in 1801 by <a4_0>Alexander Hamilton<a4_0/>. The city also has a comprehensive ethnic press, with 270 newspapers and magazines published in more than 40 languages. El Diario La Prensa is New York's largest Spanish-language daily and the oldest in the nation. The New York Amsterdam News, published in Harlem, is a prominent African American newspaper. The Village Voice is the largest alternative newspaper.
